pr_title: SAMZA-2444: JobModel save in CoordinatorStreamStore resulting flush for each message

timeline.bodyText:
Is this operation meant to be atomic? Does an impl of MetadataStore ensure that either all or none of this map is deleted?
Is this operation meant to be idempotent?
timeline.author: lakshmi-manasa-g

timeline.bodyText: minor: might be good to add {@inheritdoc}
timeline.author: lakshmi-manasa-g

timeline.bodyText: this is not atomic right. cause, theflush() is when the entries are guaranteed to be persisted on the coordinator stream and putAll does flush only at the end of all put. So if this is the expectation, then the MetadataStore interface should allow it.
timeline.author: lakshmi-manasa-g

timeline.bodyText:
would it be good to replace wirteTaskContainerMapping with the new wirteTaskContainerMappings altogether?
there seems to be only one usage of this method and that has been replaced to use the new one in JobModelManager.
is there a reason to keep this old method?
